intro: Cacalia arkansana, commonly known as the Arkansas cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Cacalia arkansana is often found in clay soils and is adapted to thrive in partial to full sunlight.
